intro: Lithocarpus comptus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a cupule. Lithocarpus comptus typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical forest ecosystems.
